body: Screwed the pooch. Forgot to change the commits cause of the couchdb history.
You'll want to submit this to http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB if you want it considered for inclusion.

Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-1307
Hope I did it right.
Cheers.
_bump_
_bump_
Let's see if comments get mailed as well.
cool
Test success!

Hi,

Sorry this has been lingering here for so long! 

Until very recently, this wasn't an official way to contribute back to Apache CouchDB.

May we kindly request that you check whether this is still an issue and update the PR accordingly?

We are now prepared and more than happy to accept pull requests :)

Cheers
Jan

I think the rewrite limit should be configurable but other than that the patch looks reasonable to me. will try it out later.
replaced with 2 new pull requests that contain tests for each issue as well
@RonnyPfannschmidt Is this related to the vhost/rewrite issue from -1416 also? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-1416
no, but it seems like that header can be used for that purpose as well, see the new pull request for x-requested-path

Awesome! I tried to fix this a long time ago, but didn't want to mess with the view server protocol on the Erlang side...

If you'd like, I provided a spec for this (it's the render.diff attachment) on one of those ancient tickets:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-514
:o} Thanks! I used that and the other patches on your bug (and the other bugs as well) as the basis for my fix. Let me know if you get a chance to test it out. I'm interested to find any bugs!

Nice!! Thanks for the proposed patch. One of the other devs will need to look at it tho.

It would be a huge ++ to have a test that demonstrates the failure before your patch, and the success afterwards. Do you want to check out https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12424604/list_views.diff and see if you can get it to apply cleanly, and then add it into your PR?
I would merge this immediately, but it seems our github integration isn't working so well today (there's no Merge button).
Hi Magnus, thanks, committed to 1.2.x and master. We're still sorting out our asf/github integration, could you close this PR now?
Sweet :) Closed.
Merged, thanks!
Added test. Seems to be working for me.
I mean, it's ready for merging ;)

LGTM, are you OK to tidy a couple things up?
- check tab/spaces in futon.js - it looks like there's a couple of strays crept in?
- might as well squash this into 1 commit

Thanks!

Hi Dave,

Thanks for the quick review!! I fixed the tab/space problems and squashed it into 1 commit. 

Thanks,
Anthony

I left a small comment on the commit. Additionally, I think it'd be great if you disabled these (prevent click and lower opacity) rather then hid them completely. It lowers the overhead of later discovery of the feature--even if they can't do it now, they know where to look next time. :)

Thanks for working on this, Anthony.

Thanks for the review and comment BigBlueHat. I agree that disabling them is a lot better. I fixed the error in my refactoring that you pointed out and instead of hiding the buttons I disabled them, preventing clicks and lowered opacity.

-Anthony
One more tweak @asbaker and I think it'll be fabulous. :)
@BigBlueHat, That CSS did feel a little funny. Should be fixed now.

Hey, no problem. That over rides the hover style for tool bar buttons, which changes the image and text to a darker grey. With the added disabled hover css it just leaves it as is and doesn't darken up the text whenever hovering.

I can put cursor in the previous selector and have the same outcome, but feel this implementation is a little more self explanatory for people who come after me to maintain it.
+1 great work. @dch wanna have the honours? :)
committed with thanks, @asbaker to master & 1.2.x. Can you close the PR for us?

Can you explain which version of CouchDB has which behaviour and for which version you are fixing this?

I looked through 1.0.x, 1.1.x, 1.2.x & master and couldn't find a conclusive answer :)
Can you verify that this doesn't break anything in for other browsers?
Actually, this looks fine. Merged, thanks! :)
Merged, thanks!
This has been committed in http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/couchdb/commit/093d2aa6

I've tried versions 1.1.x and 1.2.x which both return no results with keys=[]. I can't build 1.0.x.
The regression is on master which returns all documents with keys=[] and its master I intended the fix for.

I've just tried cherry picking first commit which just tests this functionality onto 1.2.x and the test cases all pass so you could pull that commit onto 1.2.x.
Merged, thanks!
merged, thanks!
can you close this PR?
this has been committed, can you close the PR?
This has been committed, can you close the PR?
Can you close this PR?
closed
Can you close this PR?
Can you close this PR?
Great cheers, closing now.
Updated for comments from Robert Newson.

Are there any tests to go with this?

A Pull Request is fine for couchdb now (changed recently). We're not fully integrated so you'll need to close it yourself after the merge.

Nope. I'm not sure what testing framework you use. Is there a guide?

I needed the change, so I made it and thought others might want it as well.

On Tue, Aug 7, 2012 at 6:36 PM, Robert Newson notifications@github.comwrote:

> Are there any tests to go with this?
> 
> A Pull Request is fine for couchdb now (changed recently). We're not fully
> integrated so you'll need to close it yourself after the merge.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/couchdb/pull/30#issuecomment-7569242.

Have a peek in share/www/script/test/auth_cache.js to see some login/logout assertions. The reason for the test is not just to prove your fix but also to prevent regressions.

The only other things needed for a perfect submission would be to update the CHANGES and NEWS file in the root of the project with a description of the fix. We use those files for the release notes so keeping it up to date and accurate will help us in our goal to turn out releases more regularly.
Suggest the test, if you can manage one, belongs to basics.js
+1, let's make this happen
Thanks for the patch @indutny! Is this still broken for you?
Thanks! I've merged this into our mainline branch. We are, sadly, not fully integrated with github pull requests, so can you please close this now?
You should be able to leverage the `Etag` response header instead of adding `X-Couch-Rev`, right?
Ah yes, that's true. Just need the ID then

We have an issue with nuke_dir as it stands in master, in that it doesn't work on Windows as the view server may still be holding files open. I'm guessing your patch will still suffer from this issue. I think the rename should work, but there needs to be a way to handle a lazy delete. Any suggestions? Ref https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-1346 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-780 and https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-86 for some history. My build server just died so it will be a few days before I can look at this properly. Many thanks for your contribution!
I believe the new commit should fix your issue but I don't have access to a windows box. Unfortunately it is quite a lot of extra code.
Can you add a quick test for this? Im happy to merge this then.

Hi Adam

Sweet! By tomorrow I should have finished my restore and can test this.
Many many thanks.

On 10 October 2012 14:33, adamlofts notifications@github.com wrote:

> I believe the new commit should fix your issue but I don't have access to
> a windows box. Unfortunately it is quite a lot of extra code.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/couchdb/pull/33#issuecomment-9299556.
Closing because I'm a moron.
Initial version of the rewriter was working using functions. It was never accepted for performances reasons. Not sure what to do with this one.
@tim-blair can you close this PR now? Currently we can't do it from our side. Many thanks!
@davisp anything to add?

@mikeymckay many thanks, got merged today :/. Apologies for the delay!

Can you close the PR please, it won't happen automatically unfortunately.
Let's see if we can get this into 1.3.0 - branching on 5th November! @zdzolton @aronwoost @calebcase do you want to integrate the test code above?
@bjnortier we are going to branch for 1.3.0 on Wednesday 5th. Are you able to add a test so we can get your patch in? Thanks for your contribution!

Hi @boxxxie we're going to branch 1.3.0 on Wednesday, are you able to rebase this patch, and squash it to a single commit? It would be great to get it in the next release. Thanks for your contribution!

Performance would be terrible. Unless that changes I'd consider such an approach to be dead in the water. (Although, I can of course be convinced otherwise with numbers).

Also, major changes like this need to go through JIRA.
Thanks! There are a bunch of very similar documentation issues just like this. If I find time I can create some more pull requests for them,.
Will do asap
LGTM - one question is why we only try to use the server uuid if the port is in some configurable dynamic range? Why not check for the server uuid and always use that if it exists.

That's deliberate, I didn't want to make the extra http call if it's not strictly necessary, but perhaps I've over-optimized? I would really like to hear opinions on my choice of {Scheme, UserInfo, UUID, Path} if the UUID is used. Could it just be UUID on its own? The other checkpoints include the full url, and so vary based on scheme, hostname, port, userinfo and path, but is it necessary?

i can rebase for next wed. joel and I are still working on it. we think it needs some more improvements. don't know if we can finish everything we want to do by that time, though.

also our commits are causing the 'Travis build' to fail, is this a problem? when i use the lib with futon on my test machines everything works fine. also we haven't been able to get the test suit for jquery.couch to run, so we aren't sure if we are failing tests in that code, also we should probably be adding more, at least related to the userdb code.

No worries - doesn't have to go into 1.3.0 just a heads up we are getting
ready :-)

Committed, thanks! :)

Can you close the PR for us? Thanks!
Woop!

Hmm. Didn't know my commits would end up here - thought I was pushing some small fixes to our in-house fork that @boxxxie maintains. Maybe it's time to get the test system up and running, as I've only used our local layers on top of this for testing.

Reading the code in `jquery.couch.js` isn't all smiles - there's cleanup work for sure, I just haven't completed nor architectured my changes.

Thanks for the heads up @boxxxie - now let's go get a cup of coffee in the kitchen ;)

+1
i need to put this stuff on branches.
Just now seeing your comment @dch. Running the tests now with your test case.

@dch see ac2240bcebeee92acdb343f55e58435bce235194

Before I merged with upstream only the '27 form_submit' test failed with my patch and your test applied (appears to be unrelated, was failing upstream as well).

After the merge many tests are failing with 'Reason: You are not a server admin.' It all starts to go bad after:

not ok 46 replication
Reason: expected '"joe"', got 'null'

Will have to investigate later when I have more time.

On 5 November 2012 12:00, Caleb Case notifications@github.com wrote:

> @dch https://github.com/dch see ac2240bhttps://github.com/apache/couchdb/commit/ac2240bcebeee92acdb343f55e58435bce235194
> 
> Before I merged with upstream only the '27 form_submit' test failed with
> my patch and your test applied (appears to be unrelated, was failing
> upstream as well).
> 
> After the merge many tests are failing with 'Reason: You are not a server
> admin.' It all starts to go bad after:

That happens sometimes in the tests, not your fault. A re-run usually goes
fine.
Yup, re-run and the tests all passed. Looks good from my perspective, is there anything else upstream needs to consider merging?

Just need to get some eyes on a reviewer - onto it & many thanks Caleb! I've put the info into https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COUCHDB-430 from here on.

@aronwoost feel free to take a look & @zdzolton, thanks for your work on the earlier iterations!

On 5 November 2012 20:58, Caleb Case notifications@github.com wrote:

> Yup, re-run and the tests all passed. Looks good from my perspective, is
> there anything else upstream needs to consider merging?
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/couchdb/pull/18#issuecomment-10085261.

I like the idea here. I suggest we use the Accept request header to determine response format and the manner that text is converted to JSON looks a little fiddly to me. A regexp approach might be better?

what @rnewson said, my particular bikeshed would be to keep the ?format= query arg for convenience, but definitely use the Accept-Handler by default.

I envision that people could plugin in other custom formatters in the future.

Thanks for the input and help. I've changed the parser to use regex instead which looks much nicer. Could you check the double case statement on the q-value and accept content type. Not sure if there is a better way.

I've tried a slightly different regex. Its a little tricky because to parse the logs correctly we want to match exactly 3 brackets. When reading bytes from the log file we can can incomplete lines which we want to ignore.
Looks good to me. We may want to run this through a bunch of log messages.
Thumbs up! Id say we get this into master.
heh, heyall, whats the state of this PR? Im happy to look at improvements to jquery.couch.js if they are isolated :)
_nudge_

We committed this to master, thanks for all your work!

Could you close the PR for us? (we cant at the moment :)
Yeah!
